MAN.TITLE: ciboot

DESCRIPTION.P: Compute a bootstrap confidence interval for T(X) with level C. Default for C is 0.90. Number of resamples is B, with default that is different for different methods. The method is
DESCRIPTION.DESCRIPTION_ITEM: : Studentized, std is computed via jackknife (If T is 'mean' this done the fast way via the routine TEST1B).
: Efron's percentile method with bias correction (BC).
DESCRIPTION.P: Default method is 5. Often T(X) is a number but it may also be a vector or a even a matrix. Every row of the result ci is of the form
and the corresponding element of T(X) is found by noting that t = T(X); t = t(:); is used in the routine.
